p: Quality control analyses for the RNA-Seq are shown in S3 Fig. DEGs (FDR q<0.01 and CPM>1 in at least 3 samples) are shown in S1 Table. Global analyses of DEGs illustrated, for instance, that genes regulated by poly(I:C)/jetPEI were qualitatively, if not quantitatively, similar at the two temperatures, with 22C vs 22T and 30C vs 30T showing considerable overlap ( S4 Fig). As might be expected (i) most of the up-regulated genes were ISGs ( S4 Fig) and (ii) the Molecular and Cellular Functions feature of IPA clearly illustrated that genes associated with cell growth, survival, movement, morphology and development were up-regulated in feet of mice housed at 30Â°C in the presence or absence of poly(I:C)/jetPEI treatment ( S2 Table).
